channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Harris says Trump is 'cruel' at Georgia rally as she spotlights abortion restrictions
item.description: Kamala Harris has said former President Trump is “cruel” for how he talked about the family of a Georgia mother who died after waiting for treatment for complications from an abortion pill
item.content:encoded:
Kamala Harris has said former President Trump is “cruel” for how he talked about the family of a Georgia mother who died after waiting for treatment for complications from an abortion pill

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Catholic bishops are donating millions less to defeat abortion this year. Here’s why
item.description: In recent years, Catholic bishops have spent millions on campaigns to defeat abortion rights at the ballot box. This year, they're taking a dramatically different approach.
item.content:encoded:
In recent years, Catholic bishops have spent millions on campaigns to defeat abortion rights at the ballot box. This year, they're taking a dramatically different approach.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Rosemary Westwood

item.title: Trump kicks off a Pennsylvania rally by talking about Arnold Palmer's genitalia
item.description: Trump was campaigning Saturday in Latrobe, Penn., where Palmer was born in 1929 and learned to golf from his father, who suffered from polio and was head pro and greenskeeper at the local country club.
item.content:encoded:
Trump was campaigning Saturday in Latrobe, Penn., where Palmer was born in 1929 and learned to golf from his father, who suffered from polio and was head pro and greenskeeper at the local country club.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Stanford psychologist behind the controversial 'Stanford Prison Experiment' dies at 91
item.description: Philip G. Zimbardo, the psychologist behind the controversial experiment that was intended to examine the psychological experiences of imprisonment, has died.
item.content:encoded:
Philip G. Zimbardo, the psychologist behind the controversial experiment that was intended to examine the psychological experiences of imprisonment, has died.

(Image credit: Andy Kropa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What to know about Republican challenges to overseas and military voting
item.description: In three swing states, GOP groups are suing to challenge the ballots cast by U.S. citizens living abroad, including military members. Many voting experts say these cases are likely to go nowhere.
item.content:encoded:
In three swing states, GOP groups are suing to challenge the ballots cast by U.S. citizens living abroad, including military members. Many voting experts say these cases are likely to go nowhere.

(Image credit: Allison Joyce)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inducts Cher, Foreigner, Mary J. Blige, Ozzy and more
item.description: Inductees this year also included A Tribe Called Quest and Dave Matthews Band, and posthumous recognition for Jimmy Buffett, MC5, Alexis Korner, John Mayall, Norman Whitfield and Big Mama Thornton.
item.content:encoded:
Inductees this year also included A Tribe Called Quest and Dave Matthews Band, and posthumous recognition for Jimmy Buffett, MC5, Alexis Korner, John Mayall, Norman Whitfield and Big Mama Thornton.

(Image credit: Chris Pizzello)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At least 7 dead after ferry dock gangway collapses on Georgia's Sapelo Island
item.description: Authorities said part of a ferry dock collapsed on Georgia's Sapelo Island, where crowds had gathered for a fall celebration by the island's tiny Gullah-Geechee community of Black slave descendants.
item.content:encoded:
Authorities said part of a ferry dock collapsed on Georgia's Sapelo Island, where crowds had gathered for a fall celebration by the island's tiny Gullah-Geechee community of Black slave descendants.

(Image credit: David Goldman)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.S. investigating unauthorized release of classified documents on Israel attack plans
item.description: The U.S. is investigating an unauthorized release of classified documents that assess Israel's plans to attack Iran, three U.S. officials told The Associated Press.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. is investigating an unauthorized release of classified documents that assess Israel's plans to attack Iran, three U.S. officials told The Associated Press.

(Image credit: Susan Walsh)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why the stakes for who caught Ohtani's 50/50 ball are bigger than ever
item.description: The auction for Shohei Ohtani's iconic 50/50 baseball is almost over. But three men are still fighting in court over who will get the proceeds.
item.content:encoded:
The auction for Shohei Ohtani's iconic 50/50 baseball is almost over. But three men are still fighting in court over who will get the proceeds.

(Image credit: Goldin Auctions)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Boeing union is set to vote on a new contract deal, possibly ending strike
item.description: The latest proposal includes a 35% general wage increase over four years — bringing it closer to the union's original ask for 40%. Boeing previously offered a 25% raise over the life of the contract.
item.content:encoded:
The latest proposal includes a 35% general wage increase over four years — bringing it closer to the union's original ask for 40%. Boeing previously offered a 25% raise over the life of the contract.

(Image credit: Jason Redmond)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
